page.title: 0105240282 DOMESDAY BLOCK
page.content:
This block is characterised by three main features: 1. The village of Upwood. 2. The U.S.A.F. base. 3. Acres of private farmland.
Upwood is mentioned in the Domesday Book and is a combination of old and new buildings. There is an old church and a 17th. Century inn. It has a population of 740. The new Upwood School is not in the village but on the main road close to what was once the R.A.F. base. When the R.A.F. moved out, the school numbers dropped by half. The U.S.A.F. have taken the base over, and although there is an American school on the base some of the children do come to our school. { } by Mr. J. Sockett
